props.text: Access to databases is built right into the Ignition platform.  The example below demonstrates using Named Queries along with a little scripting to allow for easy form entry.  It also demonstrates a combination of flex and column containers to dynamically grow and shrink the entry form and table. Simple data validation is done on the Add/Save button to ensure all fields are populated.  Clicking the Add, Edit, and Delete buttons below the table toggle visibility of the Tank Entry Form / Delete Confirmation.

config.script:
# Clear entry fields
	tankInfo = {
	  "tankInUse": 0,
	  "tankMaxVol": None,
	  "tankName": "",
	  "tankNo": None,
	  "tankVol": None,
	  "tankType": ""
	}
	
	self.view.custom.tankInfo = tankInfo
	
	self.view.custom.mode = 'add'
	
	# Hide Delete Confirmation container
	self.parent.parent.getChild("Delete Confirmation").position.display = False
	
	# Display Tank Entry Form container
	self.parent.parent.getChild("Entry Form").position.display = True

# Set the entry form mode to 'edit'
	self.view.custom.mode = 'edit'
	
	# Copy the tank info from the selected row to the custom property
	self.view.custom.tankInfo = self.parent.parent.getChild("Table").props.selection.data[0]
	
	# Hide the Delete Confirmation container
	self.parent.parent.getChild("Delete Confirmation").position.display = False
	
	# Display the Entry Form container
	self.parent.parent.getChild("Entry Form").position.display = True

tooltip.text: Select a record in the table

config.script:
# Hide the Entry Form container
	self.parent.parent.getChild("Entry Form").position.display = False
	
	# Display the Delete Confirmation container
	self.parent.parent.getChild("Delete Confirmation").position.display = True

tooltip.text: Select a record in the table

config.script:
# This script will add or edit a record for the tank in the database table.
	# First we get our field values into a dictionary
	tankDetails = {
		"tankNo":     self.parent.parent.getChild("Tank Number").props.value,
		"tankName":   self.parent.parent.getChild("Tank Name").props.text,
		"tankType":   self.parent.parent.getChild("Tank Type").props.value,
		"tankVol":    self.parent.parent.getChild("Tank Volume").props.value,
		"tankMaxVol": self.parent.parent.getChild("Tank Max Volume").props.value,
		"tankInUse":  self.parent.parent.getChild("Tank In Use").props.selected
	}
	
	# Next we run a named query.
	# If our custom property "mode" is 'add', execute the named query "Add Tank".
	if self.view.custom.mode == "add":
		system.db.runNamedQuery("Ignition 101/Data Entry/Add Tank", tankDetails)
	# Otherwise, execute the named query "Edit Tank".
	else:
		system.db.runNamedQuery("Ignition 101/Data Entry/Edit Tank", tankDetails)
	
	# Next we need to refresh the table's data binding
	self.parent.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Table").refreshBinding('props.data')
	
	# Hide the Tank Entry Form container
	self.parent.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Entry Form").position.display = False
	
	# That's it.  Let's clear our data so the entry form is ready for the next user action.
	tankInfo = {
	  "tankInUse": 0,
	  "tankMaxVol": None,
	  "tankName": "",
	  "tankNo": None,
	  "tankVol": None,
	  "tankType": ""
	}
	
	self.view.custom.tankInfo = tankInfo

# Hide Tank Entry Form container
	self.parent.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Entry Form").position.display = False

config.expression: 'Are you sure you want to delete "' + {..../Table.props.selection.data[0].tankName} + '" (Tank #' + {..../Table.props.selection.data[0].tankNo} + ')?'

config.script:
# This script deletes the tank from the database.
	
	# First, let's get the tank number from the selected row
	#tankNo = self.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Flex Container").getChild("Table").props.selection.data[0].tankNo
	tankNo = self.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Table").props.selection.data[0].tankNo
	
	# Then we'll call a Named Query to delete the record
	system.db.runNamedQuery("Ignition 101/Data Entry/Delete Tank", {"tankNo": tankNo})
	
	# Next we need to refresh the table's data binding
	self.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Table").refreshBinding('props.data')
	
	# Hide Delete Confirmation container
	self.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Delete Confirmation").position.display = False
	
	# Lastly, let's clear our data so the entry form is ready for the next user action.
	tankInfo = {
	  "tankInUse": 0,
	  "tankMaxVol": None,
	  "tankName": "",
	  "tankNo": None,
	  "tankVol": None,
	  "tankType": ""
	}
	
	self.view.custom.tankInfo = tankInfo

# Hide Delete Confirmation container
	self.parent.parent.parent.getChild("Delete Confirmation").position.display = False

props.text: Popup windows and message handlers can also be used for data entry as seen on the Message Handlers feature page.
Open this view in the Designer: Ignition 101/Feature Views/Application/Data Entry
